bibl.title: The Dog Mummy, the Ticks and the Louse Fly: Archaeological Report of Severe Ectoparasitosis in Ancient Egypt.
bibl.note: 1. Introduction. - 2. Archaeology at the El Deir site. - 3. Material and methods. - 4. Results: 4.1. Description of the dog [to be dated to the Roman period]; - 4.2. The ectoparasites; - 4.3. The carrion fauna. - 5. Discussion. - 6. Conclusion. - Avec résumé en anglais.
bibl.seg: J.B. Huchet, C. Callou, Roger Lichtenberg & Françoise Dunand, The Dog Mummy, the Ticks and the Louse Fly: Archaeological Report of Severe Ectoparasitosis in Ancient Egypt.
International Journal of Paleopathology 3 (2013) pp. 71-82, 4 tabl., 8 figg.

1. Introduction. - 2. Archaeology at the El Deir site. - 3. Material and methods. - 4. Results: 4.1. Description of the dog [to be dated to the Roman period]; - 4.2. The ectoparasites; - 4.3. The carrion fauna. - 5. Discussion. - 6. Conclusion. - Avec résumé en anglais.
